Sentencas: Bulk samples consisting of BaCe0.85Y0.15O3-delta (BCY15) and Ce0.85Y0.15O2-delta (YDC15) compounds, mixed together in different ratios, were studied as potential electrolytes in dual protonic ceramic-solid oxide fuel cells and compared with non-composite BCY15 and YDC15.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The microstructures of the sintered materials indicate that BCY15 exhibits the largest grains, whereas composites have greater visible porosity than the non-composite samples.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: From X-ray diffraction studies it follows that BCY15
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: and YDC15 consist mainly of one phase, whereas the composites are two-phase materials.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy studies at different temperatures show that the composite materials are capable of conduction the order of 10(-3) S/cm at temperatures above 500 degrees C in a hydrogen-containing atmosphere.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, activation energy values of the conductivity determined for the composites in air atmosphere are between those obtained for BCY15 (E-a = 0.590 +/- 0.017 eV) and YDC15 (E-a = 1.132N +/- 0.008 eV).
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: From this it follows that both phases of the composites influence the electrical conductivity of the materials.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In conclusion, BCY15 and the BCY15-YDC15 composites show promise for future use as electrolytes in dual protonic ceramic-solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Electrical Properties of BaCeO3-Based Electrolytes for use in Dual Protonic Ceramic-Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
